alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Harnett; Hoke; Lee; Moore (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 11:10AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EASTERN MOORE...HARNETT...LEE... NORTHERN HOKE AND SOUTHEASTERN CHATHAM COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 PM EST... At 1109 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles east of Carthage, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sanford, Southern Pines, Lillington, Angier, Whispering Pines, Coats, Broadway, Vass, Cameron, and Lemon Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. If the storm intensifies and rotation strengthens, a warning may need to be issued. Be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
